results.title: Raising Victor Vargas
results.creator_credit: Peter Sollett, Alain de la Mata, Robin O'hara, Scott Macaulay and Studio Canal
results.brief_description: Victor (Victor Rasuk) a New York City teenager gets caught trying to sleep with ‘Fat Donna’ when his younger sister Vicki (Krystal Rodriguez) realises what he’s up to and spreads the word in the neighbourhood. Victor, thinking his reputation has suffered a blow, quells the summer heat with a visit to the local public pool with his best friend Harold. Here he meets ‘Juicy Judy’ (Judy Marte) and he decides to pursue her. Living in a small apartment with his strict Grandmother, sister and piano-playing younger brother Nino (Rasuk’s real-life brother Silvestre), Victor finds life as a teenager challenging when he gets the blame for having a bad influence on his siblings. Coming-of-age is tough (and sometimes comical) for Victor as he finds real love, gets a glimpse of what manhood is about and asserts his place within the family. Based on the short film “Five Feet High and Rising” by its writer/director Peter Sollett. Cast also includes Kevin Rivera, Altagracia Guzman, Melonie Diaz.

results.title: American splendor
results.creator_credit: Robert Pulcini, Shari Springer Berman, Ted Hope, Fine Line Features and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: The life and times of American comic book writer Harvey Pekar - meet the real man, and the actor playing him (Paul Giamatti), in a movie about his “ordinary life”. Based on Harvey’s comic book “American Splendor” written by Harvey and illustrated by R.Crumb, he details the mundanities of ordinary life in such a way that makes for a great commentary on working class life in everyday America. The film covers the period of Harvey’s life when he gets divorced, looses his voice and compulsively collects old jazz records, to the time when he meets his new wife (Hope Davis), goes on the “Letterman” show to promote the comic, gets cancer and goes on to be part of this film. Cleverly realised we traverse his life via comics and actors, as well as interjections from the real Harvey, making an “ordinary life” quite compelling viewing.

results.title: The Man without a past
results.creator_credit: Aki Kaurismaki, Pandora Films, Pyramide Productions and Sputnik Oy
results.brief_description: Typically quirky feature from Finnish director Aki Kaurismaki about a man, M, who travels to Helsinki, is brutally bashed, and loses his identity after suffering from amnesia. Knowing nothing about his past, M is adopted by a community of vagrants, living in shipping containers on the wharf. Despite the harsh conditions, the residents find enough food and shelter to keep them comfortable and even participate in festive evenings. M fits nicely into his new environs, eventually meeting a young woman with whom romance blossoms. Utilising his signature dark humour Kaurismaki explores the idea that happiness is what you make of life in this relatively upbeat, humanistic and wry work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aki Kaurismaki, Pandora Films, Pyramide Productions and Sputnik Oy

results.title: My voyage to Italy = Il Mio Viaggio In Italia
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Barbara de Fina, Giuliana Del Punta and Media Trade Cappa Productions
results.brief_description: Interweaving his personal history, growing up in Italian-American culture of New York in the 1940s, Martin Scorsese presents his fascinating perspective on the cinema of Italian Neo-Realism. As a young boy, Scorsese watched innumerable of these iconic works on his parents tiny TV set, subtly influencing what would become his cinematic style. Using extensive clips from such works as “Rome, Open city”, “La Dolce vita”, “L’Aventura” and “8 and 1/2” Scorsese discusses his love and enduring admiration of these works whilst analysing the mise en scene and meanings behind the motifs. As well as being a fascinating insight into Scorseses influences, “My Voyage to Italy” inspires the viewer to re-visit the work of the Italian Neo-Realists. Directors featured include Antonioni, Di Sica, Fellini, Renoir, Rossellini, Visconti, and Blaseti.

results.title: Travelling birds = Winged migration = Le Peuple Migrateur
results.creator_credit: Jacques Perrin, Bac Films (France), Eyescreen Production and France 2 Cinema
results.brief_description: Filmed over three years “Travelling birds” shows in dazzling detail how a variety of birds journey to assorted parts of their globe on an annual migration to warmer climes. What sets this work apart from most nature documentaries is its perspective the camera is actually in the air with these creatures, showing the animals unique perspective. The documentary also covers the foes that threaten birds: man, pollution, predators and accidents that hamper their abilities. Producer, director and screenwriter Jacques Perrin, creates a fabulously lyrical work that is supported by minimal narration allowing the visuals to tell the story.

results.title: Mississippi masala [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Michael Nozik, Film Four International and SCS Films
results.brief_description: A refreshingly tender film about race relations in the United States that manages to be both intelligent and complex. Mina (Roshan Seth) is an Indian woman whose family fled Uganda during the rule of Idi Amin. She falls in love with Demetrius (Denzel Washington), an African-American who is challenged by the traditions of her Indian background. She in turn has to fight against her family’s fears and racism. Without histrionics this film paints a picture of small-town Americana that is rich and diverse. A wonderful comic love story with excellent performances.

results.title: Riff raff [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ken Loach, Sally Hibbin, Channel Four, Newvision Films and Parallax Pictures
results.brief_description: Follows the fortunes (and misfortunes) of Stevie, a young labourer fresh out of jail. He soon finds work on a building site, converting an old hospital into luxury apartments. Stevie finds support and fellowship from his fellow workers, a melting pot of men from different parts of England. Conditions on the site are lousy, as well as unsafe, and with no help from the developers, Stevie along with his mates take matters into their own hands.

results.title: Solaris (2003)
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, James Cameron, Jon Landau, Rae Sanchini, Lightstorm Entertainment and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pyschologist Dr. Chris Kelvin (George Clooney) has been assigned to investigate the mysterious events occurring aboard a space station orbiting the planet Solaris. He discovers that the two surviving members on the station are struggling with their sanity and that the planet itself is a living organism with the power of entering human consciousness and recreating lost loves. Chris Kelvin is haunted by the visitation of his dead wife Khari (Natascha McElhone). This film is a remake of the more philosophical version by Andrei Tarkovsky released in 1972, and is more a personal investigation into the themes of memory and regret rather than spirituality and science. Beautiful production design lends itself to the dreamy and sensual pace. Based on the novel by Stanislaw Lem, this version is written and directed by Steven Soderbergh. Cast includes Jeremy Davies, Viola Davis and Ulrich Tukur.

constellations_other.name: Returning to Solaris
constellations_other.description: Stanislaw Lem’s novel Solaris (1961) tells the haunting story of a space research expedition’s encounter with a sentient ocean planet. Here we look at how different artists have responded to, remixed and referenced Solaris over film, television, and videogames.

results.title: Le Divorce
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, Ismail Merchant, Michael Schiffer, Fox Searchlight Pictures, Merchant Ivory Productions and Radar Pictures
results.brief_description: A stellar ensemble cast in this romantic drama/comedy about a cultural clash between a French husband, his American wife (Naomi Watts) and her sister (Kate Hudson). From the creative team of Merchant Ivory comes this study of romantic relationships, wealth and culture. Based on the novel by Diane Johnson. Cast includes Glenn Close, Stephen Fry, Leslie Caron and Stockard Channing.

results.title: 28 days later = twenty eight days later
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew Macdonald, DNA (Korea), Film Council and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Upon waking after being in a coma for 28 days, bicycle courier Jim (Cillian Murphy) finds a completely different world. London is empty except for the virally infected zombies that want to murder everyone - and there aren’t many people left. Jim is rescued by Selena (Naomie Harris) who proves to be a strong and fearless survivor. The virus is passed on through blood and devastates within seconds, driving the infected into a murderous rage that essentially threatens human existence. But is the virus all that endangers the survivors? End-of-the-world survival tale done in a dark and sombre mood - a science-fiction horror story from the director of “Trainspotting” and “The Beach”, Danny Boyle. Cast includes Christopher Eccleston, Megan Burns and Brendan Gleeson. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.
